<!-- This form is for bug reports and feature requests ONLY!

If you're looking for help check [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/kubernetes) and the [troubleshooting guide](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/debug-application-cluster/troubleshooting/).

If this may be security issue, please disclose it privately via https://kubernetes.io/security/.
-->

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

/kind bug


**What happened**:
Pods are in CrashBackOffLoop after upgrade to v1.8.13 from v1.8.10. Pod event log:
```
Events:
  Type     Reason                 Age                From                                   Message
  ----     ------                 ----               ----                                   -------
  Normal   Scheduled              1m                 default-scheduler                      Successfully assigned mycontainer-7b9cc74d64-zl27d to ip-10-35-85-82.ec2.internal
  Normal   SuccessfulMountVolume  1m                 kubelet, ip-10-35-85-82.ec2.internal  MountVolume.SetUp succeeded for volume "resolv-conf"
  Normal   SuccessfulMountVolume  1m                 kubelet, ip-10-35-85-82.ec2.internal  MountVolume.SetUp succeeded for volume "default-token-j7sx2"
  Warning  Failed                 48s (x3 over 1m)   kubelet, ip-10-35-85-82.ec2.internal  Error: failed to start container "mycontainer": Error response from daemon: chown /var/lib/kubelet/pods/2c224e30-5d35-11e8-9a6d-0eeef00298ba/volume-subpaths/resolv-conf/mycontainer/0: read-only file system
  Warning  BackOff                39s (x2 over 40s)  kubelet, ip-10-35-85-82.ec2.internal  Back-off restarting failed container
  Normal   Pulling                27s (x4 over 1m)   kubelet, ip-10-35-85-82.ec2.internal  pulling image "123456789012.dkr.ecr.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/mycontainer:mylabel"
  Normal   Pulled                 27s (x4 over 1m)   kubelet, ip-10-35-85-82.ec2.internal  Successfully pulled image "123456789012.dkr.ecr.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/mycontainer:mylabel"
  Normal   Created                27s (x4 over 1m)   kubelet, ip-10-35-85-82.ec2.internal  Created container
  Warning  FailedSync             27s (x6 over 1m)   kubelet, ip-10-35-85-82.ec2.internal  Error syncing pod
```

Related logs from node syslog:
```
May 21 20:28:50 ip-10-35-85-82 dockerd[1538]: time="2018-05-21T20:28:50.508269569Z" level=error msg="Handler for POST /v1.26/containers/68242e4980877f4a761ed12ed0384d01e815bad46a8a051a1868f52b99f71551/start returned error: chown /var/lib/kubelet/pods/2c224e30-5d35-11e8-9a6d-0eeef00298ba/volume-subpaths/resolv-conf/mycontainer/0: read-only file system"
May 21 20:28:50 ip-10-35-85-82 kubelet[1709]: E0521 20:28:50.508932    1709 remote_runtime.go:209] StartContainer "68242e4980877f4a761ed12ed0384d01e815bad46a8a051a1868f52b99f71551" from runtime service failed: rpc error: code = Unknown desc = failed to start container "68242e4980877f4a761ed12ed0384d01e815bad46a8a051a1868f52b99f71551": Error response from daemon: chown /var/lib/kubelet/pods/2c224e30-5d35-11e8-9a6d-0eeef00298ba/volume-subpaths/resolv-conf/mycontainer/0: read-only file system
May 21 20:28:50 ip-10-35-85-82 kubelet[1709]: E0521 20:28:50.509033    1709 kuberuntime_manager.go:718] container start failed: RunContainerError: failed to start container "68242e4980877f4a761ed12ed0384d01e815bad46a8a051a1868f52b99f71551": Error response from daemon: chown /var/lib/kubelet/pods/2c224e30-5d35-11e8-9a6d-0eeef00298ba/volume-subpaths/resolv-conf/mycontainer/0: read-only file system
May 21 20:28:50 ip-10-35-85-82 kubelet[1709]: E0521 20:28:50.509085    1709 pod_workers.go:182] Error syncing pod 2c224e30-5d35-11e8-9a6d-0eeef00298ba("mycontainer-7b9cc74d64-zl27d_default(2c224e30-5d35-11e8-9a6d-0eeef00298ba)"), skipping: failed to "StartContainer" for "mycontainer" with RunContainerError: "failed to start container \"68242e4980877f4a761ed12ed0384d01e815bad46a8a051a1868f52b99f71551\": Error response from daemon: chown/var/lib/kubelet/pods/2c224e30-5d35-11e8-9a6d-0eeef00298ba/volume-subpaths/resolv-conf/mycontainer/0: read-only file system"
```

Deployment yaml:
```
        volumeMounts:
          - name: resolv-conf
            mountPath: /etc/resolv.conf
            subPath: resolv.conf
      volumes:
        - name: resolv-conf
          configMap:
            name: resolv-conf-retries-configmap
            optional: true
```

**What you expected to happen**:
Be able to launch pod with volumeMount from configMap.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
Try to mount a subPath from a configmap as seen in deployment snippet.

**Anything else we need to know?**:
Downgrade to v1.8.12 resolved the problem.

Also tried specifying readOnly: true in the volumeMount with no change in behavior.

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"8", GitVersion:"v1.8.10", GitCommit:"044cd262c40234014f01b40ed7b9d09adbafe9b1", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2018-03-19T17:51:28Z", GoVersion:"go1.8.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"8", GitVersion:"v1.8.13", GitCommit:"290fb182489a396dce5d136451388f9b12f29c94", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2018-05-15T18:08:47Z", GoVersion:"go1.8.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration: AWS
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): 
```
PRETTY_NAME="Debian GNU/Linux 8 (jessie)"
NAME="Debian GNU/Linux"
VERSION_ID="8"
VERSION="8 (jessie)"
ID=debian
HOME_URL="http://www.debian.org/"
SUPPORT_URL="http://www.debian.org/support"
BUG_REPORT_URL="https://bugs.debian.org/"
```
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): Linux ip-172-18-85-82 4.4.115-k8s #1 SMP Thu Feb 8 15:37:40 UTC 2018 x86_64 GNU/Linux
- Install tools: kops 1.9.0
- Others:
